10.1145/3311957.3359496.title: How Do Moral Values Differ in Tweets on Social Movements?
10.1145/3311957.3359496.author: Rezapour, Rezvaneh and Ferronato, Priscilla and Diesner, Jana
10.1145/3311957.3359496.paperMotivationText: They hypothesize that moral values are distinct across different social movements.
10.1145/3311957.3359496.paperContributionText: They analyze the prevalence of moral foundations in tweets related to four social movements in the US. They determine the prevalence of MF using word counts in an enhanced version of MFD.
10.1145/3311957.3359496.paperResultsText: Harm is the most prominent moral value in all four datasets. Otherwise, different values are more or less prominent in the four datasets.
